channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Afghans seeking asylum say the dream of reaching the U.S. seems ever further away
item.description: Afghans who were in the process of seeking asylum in the United States have had their hopes repeatedly dashed under this Trump administration. In the U.S., they live in fear of ICE detention.
item.content:encoded: Afghans who were in the process of seeking asylum in the United States have had their hopes repeatedly dashed under this Trump administration. In the U.S., they live in fear of ICE detention.
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid

item.title: This organization is trying to use AI to reshape American politics
item.description: Using artificial intelligence to identify congressional districts where independent candidates could win, an organization called the Independent Center is aiming to disrupt the two-party system.
item.content:encoded: Using artificial intelligence to identify congressional districts where independent candidates could win, an organization called the Independent Center is aiming to disrupt the two-party system.
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: This man serenades tourists in a Boston park with a taste of their homeland
item.description: We meet a man who serenades tourists in a national park in Massachusetts with songs of their homeland in their native language. And he's got a song for almost any nation.
item.content:encoded: We meet a man who serenades tourists in a national park in Massachusetts with songs of their homeland in their native language. And he's got a song for almost any nation.
item.dc:creator: Craig LeMoult

item.title: Jamaica rebuilds for resistance after Hurricane Melissa
item.description: Hurricane Melissa leveled homes across Jamaica — now the country must figure out how to rebuild smarter before the next monster storm hits.
item.content:encoded: Hurricane Melissa leveled homes across Jamaica — now the country must figure out how to rebuild smarter before the next monster storm hits.
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta

item.title: Alpine ski racer Mikaela Shiffrin qualifies for the upcoming Winter Olympics
item.description: Mikaela Shiffrin, a gold medal contender in the upcoming Winter Olympics in Italy is on a tear early in this winter's alpine ski racing season. She's now won all three slalom races.
item.content:encoded: Mikaela Shiffrin, a gold medal contender in the upcoming Winter Olympics in Italy is on a tear early in this winter's alpine ski racing season. She's now won all three slalom races.
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: Does Congress see war crimes in Venezuela?
item.description: Amid reports Pete Hegseth ordered a second strike on a Venezuelan boat, NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Virginia Democratic Sen. Tim Kaine about how Congress is handling oversight of the Pentagon.
item.content:encoded: Amid reports Pete Hegseth ordered a second strike on a Venezuelan boat, NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Virginia Democratic Sen. Tim Kaine about how Congress is handling oversight of the Pentagon.
item.dc:creator: Courtney Dorning

item.title: Thanksgiving weekend saw the lowest gasoline prices in more than four years
item.description: AAA says the average price of gasoline nationwide has dropped to just over $3 per gallon.
item.content:encoded: AAA says the average price of gasoline nationwide has dropped to just over $3 per gallon.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Days of our tariffs: The trade war is playing out like a soap opera
item.description: The trade war and tariff changes are playing out like a soap opera. So our Planet Money team is checking in on the impacts one life at a time.
item.content:encoded: The trade war and tariff changes are playing out like a soap opera. So our Planet Money team is checking in on the impacts one life at a time.
item.dc:creator: Kenny Malone

item.title: Months of tumult and waves of staff cuts take a toll on the CDC
item.description: After losing thousands of staffers and facing attacks this year, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention is hampered in its ability to protect the public from health problems and emergencies.
item.content:encoded: After losing thousands of staffers and facing attacks this year, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention is hampered in its ability to protect the public from health problems and emergencies.
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: As FBI investigation continues, the search for clues in National Guard shooting
item.description: As the FBI continues it's investigation in the shooting of two National Guard members last week, the shooting suspect's time in a CIA-backed unit in his native Afghanistan may provide some clues.
item.content:encoded: As the FBI continues it's investigation in the shooting of two National Guard members last week, the shooting suspect's time in a CIA-backed unit in his native Afghanistan may provide some clues.
item.dc:creator: Tom Bowman
